With tuition fees ranging from $42,000 to $75,000, these institutions provide students with specialized education and excellent career prospects in various legal domains.

Pressure mounts on the state government to ensure a fair resolution.

title: DU offers dual-degree with regular and distance courses: Will students bite off more than they can chew? Pros and cons to consider
description: Delhi University now permits students to earn two degrees simultaneously, one through regular courses and another via Open and Distance Learning. This offers flexibility but may increase workload and stress. Students must meet academic criteria for both degrees individually and carefully plan to avoid burnout.

title: State reminds pvt med colleges to follow SC mandate, resume admissions; colleges wait for assurance on fee reimbursements
description: Private medical colleges in Maharashtra have halted MBBS and BDS admissions from October 1, demanding assurance from the state government on timely reimbursement of funds. The colleges claim they are owed Rs 30-50 crores annually and are struggling to manage increasing costs and teachers' salaries.

title: Indian and Nigerian youth are shaping the future together through cultural exchanges, entrepreneurship, women empowerment
description: A virtual conference between Indian and Nigerian youths explored cultural exchanges, entrepreneurship, and women empowerment. Officials emphasized leveraging historical ties and enhancing academic collaborations through education reforms and micro-financing to build a prosperous future for both nations.

title: Odisha govt recruits 16,000 junior teachers in a single day, aims to improve quality of education
description: The Odisha government has recruited 16,009 junior teachers across the state, with appointments handed out at a Kalinga Stadium event attended by Chief Minister Mohan Majhi and Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan. The recruitment aims to enhance education quality and fulfil governmental promises.

title: Survey shows 90% of Indian employees contacted outside work hours: 7 psychology-backed tips to disconnect and recharge after work
description: A survey by Indeed reveals that over 90% of Indian employees are contacted outside work hours, leading to severe work-life balance challenges. With 79% fearing missed promotions for ignoring after-hours communication, experts urge 'right to disconnect' policies to mitigate burnout and stress.

title: RUHS BSc Nursing Result 2024 declared for Semester I Main exam, direct link to download here
description: RUHS announced the B.Sc. Nursing I Semester (Main) exam results for 2024 on October 5. Students can check their scores on ruhsraj.org or bscnursing2024.com. title: How Princeton University's Aid Program Works? All you need to know
description: Princeton University offers need-based financial aid, ensuring that applying for aid does not disadvantage students during admission. The university follows a need-blind policy, assessing each family's financial circumstances individually. Full financial need is met through grants, not loans, making Princeton accessible to low- and middle-income students without academic or athletic merit considerations. Check important details here.

title: UPSC IFS Mains exam date 2024 announced: Check full schedule here

title: IIM Bangalore vs IIM Mumbai:  Who leads the placement race? A comparative analysis
description: IIM Bangalore and IIM Mumbai, both top-ranked in the NIRF 2024 management category, are renowned for their academic excellence and campuses. However, a key differentiator between the two is their placement records. In this article, we’ll compare the placement performances of these premier institutes to determine which excels in offering better career opportunities.

title: Should students be signed up for tuition centres below 16? Rajasthan government's proposed Coaching Bill sparks debate
description: In India, rising student suicides linked to intense academic pressure, particularly in coaching hubs like Kota, have prompted government intervention. While aimed at enhancing mental well-being and promoting holistic learning, these restrictions may hinder early preparation for competitive exams.

However, compulsory courses from the first programme will replace similar requirements in the second, ensuring no duplication. Dual credits cannot be combined for a major or minor.

title: IAS aspirants to retain control over their credentials under govt's new ad norms
description: The Central Consumer Protection Authority will soon order IAS coaching centres to cease the practice of requiring aspirants to sign agreements at the time of enrolment, allowing the use of their credentials—such as photos, rank, video clips, or messages—claiming success in the prestigious UPSC exam.

title: Punjab government promoting 300 English lecturers starts uproar as they have zero expertise in the subject: Report
description: Over 300 teachers in Punjab were promoted to English lecturers for classes 11 and 12, but only three have expertise in the language. Most promoted teachers previously taught other subjects, highlighting a shortage of qualified English educators in government schools.

title: UPPBPB UP Police Constable Answer Key 2024 OUT: Check the download link for August 23 exam answer key on uppbpb.gov.in.
description: UPPBPB UP Police Constable Answer Key 2024 has been released on Wednesday. Know how to download the provisional answer key on uppbpb.gov.in.

title: West Asia crisis hits Iran's status as favoured place for higher studies among Kashmiri families
description: Families of Kashmiri students in Iran are anxious amid rising West Asia tensions, particularly with the Israel-Hezbollah and Israel-Hamas conflicts. Many fear for the safety of their children and are reconsidering sending them for higher studies there. Career consultancies report a significant drop in student admissions to Iran. Parents and consultancies stay connected to ensure students' safety.

title: New F-1 visa rules pose challenges for international students in the US
description: Recent changes to F-1 visa regulations impose stricter limits on how long international students can spend outside the US, restricting them to a maximum of five consecutive months during their academic programs. This poses challenges for students aiming to participate in study abroad programs, internships, and research projects, potentially forcing them to forgo valuable international experiences.

title: Indian student applications to Australia plummet: What's behind the dramatic dip in numbers
description: Applications from Indian students, the second largest source of international students in Australia, have fallen by 66 percent, according to The Sydney Morning Herald. Overall, overseas student applications have halved since the introduction of higher fees and stricter regulations in July, raising concerns among universities about potential economic impacts.

title: France wants to host 30,000 Indian students in the coming year
description: The French Ambassador to India, Thierry Mathou, announced France's goal to host 30,000 Indian students in the coming year, emphasizing the importance of enhancing people-to-people exchanges in the bilateral relationship. This initiative aligns with President Macron's earlier commitment made during his visit to India in January.

title: Applying for a UK Student visa? Here’s all you need to know
description: To study in the UK, students aged 16 or older need to apply for a Student visa or Child Student visa. Application timings vary depending on whether you're inside or outside the UK. The duration of stay depends on the course level. Fees and healthcare surcharges apply.

title: UK universities' tuition fees set to spike: What it means for students
description: UK university tuition fees for domestic students are set to increase for the first time in seven years due to a financial crisis affecting about 40% of higher-education providers. Institutions are advocating for fees to be indexed to inflation to prevent further erosion of their value, as current funding levels are at their lowest in two decades.

title: Why Ivy leagues have an Indian problem?
description: In a recent interview, Malcolm Gladwell addressed the bias against Asian-American and Indian students in Ivy League admissions, particularly at Harvard. He criticized Harvard's practices for favoring affluent white students and compared its admissions process with Caltech's merit-based approach, highlighting that the percentage of Asian-American students at Caltech rose from 25% to 43% between 1992 and 2013, while Harvard's percentage remained at 15-20%.

title: What is India Young Professionals Scheme visa?
description: Indian citizens aged 18 to 30 can apply for the India Young Professionals Scheme visa to live and work in the UK for up to two years. Applicants must be selected through a ballot, have an eligible qualification, and show savings of £2,530. Successful applicants must apply within 90 days and travel to the UK within six months.

title: UK universities push for tuition fee hike
description: UK universities have proposed a reform package aimed at increasing participation among under-25s to 70% by 2040, enhancing the economy, training healthcare professionals, and supporting net-zero initiatives. The report by Universities UK calls for increased public funding to shift the financial burden from students to the government and suggests that tuition fees be linked to inflation to maintain their real-term value.

title: Canada's new project to streamline review process for rejected study permits: Eligibility, how to apply?
description: If your Canadian study permit was rejected, you may soon benefit from Canada’s new Study Permit Pilot Project launching on October 1. This initiative aims to expedite the judicial review process for rejected study permit applications, potentially reducing processing times from 14-18 months to under five months.

title: Study hard or go home? Canada tightens immigration rules for students
description: Canada's immigration minister, Marc Miller, announced that the cap on international students will remain in place with new measures to manage temporary resident arrivals. Changes include modifications to the post-graduate work programme and spousal work eligibility, impacting Indian students significantly. These measures aim to reduce the share of temporary residents by 2025.

title: QS global MBA rankings 2025: Top 10 business schools in the world revealed
description: The QS Full-Time MBA Rankings 2025 highlight 340 leading business schools from 58 countries, showcasing both full-time MBA and popular Business Master's programs. The United States continues to dominate, securing the top three spots, with Stanford Graduate School of Business ranked first for the fifth consecutive year, followed by The Wharton School and Harvard Business School.

title: Here’s how much it will cost you to study at some of Canada’s top universities
description: Canada has emerged as a top destination for international students due to its cultural diversity and prestigious universities, with an average annual tuition of CAD 40,115 for full-time undergraduates in 2024. Notable institutions include the University of Toronto, ranked 25th globally, where tuition ranges from CAD 61,720 to CAD 67,370, and living costs in downtown Toronto can reach CAD 3,000 per month. McGill University in Montreal offers a lower cost of living, with tuition at CAD 47,281.69 for Arts and rent averaging CAD 2,300 monthly.

title: Prodigy Finance announces $5,000 scholarship for Jan 2025 intake students: All you need to know
description: Prodigy Finance has announced a $5,000 scholarship for students pursuing higher education abroad for the Spring 2025 intake. Applications open in September 2024 and close on September 30, 2024. Eligible candidates must be accepted into a Prodigy Finance-supported program and demonstrate academic excellence and community commitment.

title: What happens if your US student visa is cancelled?
description: Securing a US student visa is just the beginning for international students. Maintaining it is crucial, as violations like prolonged absence, unauthorized transfer, or fraudulent activities can lead to revocation. Immediate steps include understanding the reason, contacting university services, reapplying or appealing, and seeking legal assistance if necessary.

title: The pitfalls of cheating on your TOEFL or GRE test
description: Using unethical means to gain university admission can lead to severe consequences, including visa cancellation and deportation. Sachin Jain of ETS India & South Asia emphasizes the importance of academic integrity. Recent enhancements to the TOEFL test aim to help students prepare better and reduce stress during the exam process.

title: Navigating Global Education: Visa caps, financial strain, and the future of higher learning for Indian students
description: Indian students face new challenges in studying abroad due to policy changes in the UK and Canada. Visa restrictions, rising costs, and uncertain post-study work opportunities are reshaping their options. However, aligning academic goals with emerging industries and careful financial planning can help navigate these uncertainties.

title: Canada, Australia, UK visa curbs set to hit Indian students hard; new destinations like Germany, France, Spain in focus
description: With Canada, Australia, and the UK tightening study visa rules, a decline in Indian students is expected for spring 2025. Students may opt for alternative destinations like Germany, France, and Spain. However, the increased intake in these countries is unlikely to fully compensate for the anticipated decline in traditional destinations.

title: UK hikes international student maintenance requirements
description: The UK has increased the financial savings requirements for international students for the first time since 2020. Starting January 2, 2025, students coming to London must show evidence of £1,483 per month, while those studying elsewhere in the UK will need £1,136 per month. The current requirements are £1,334 for London and £1,023 for other areas.

title: Canada's international student commencements likely to drop by 50% this year
description: In January, Canada announced a temporary cap on study visas for international students, leading to a projected 35% decrease in approved study permits for 2024, with an estimated 364,000 permits issued. The ICEF Monitor reports a 54% drop in new study permit applications in Q2 2024 compared to Q2 2023, with a projected 39% annual decline.

title: Rich Indians are dipping into their savings to send their kids abroad for education
description: A survey reveals that over three-fourth of wealthy Indians are keen on sending their children overseas for education. The United States, United Kingdom, and Canada are the top destinations. Parents are willing to face financial strains, even dipping into retirement savings, to ensure quality education for their children.

title: Indian students continue to lead in Germany's international students enrollment
description: Germany remains a top destination for Indian students, who now make up the largest international student group in the country for the second consecutive year. According to the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD), the number of Indian students has more than doubled in the past five years, reaching 49,483 for the Winter Semester 2023-2024, marking a 15.1% increase over the previous year.

title: Australia's reputation as a go-to destination for foreign students is tanking. All thanks to their new rules
description: Australia's global reputation for high-quality tertiary education could be at risk due to proposed caps on international student numbers, according to Universities Australia Chair David Lloyd. The center-left Labor government's plan aims to limit foreign student places to 270,000 for 2025, with 175,000 for higher education and 95,000 for skills colleges.

title: 7 reasons to pick New Zealand as Australia tightens rules for international students
description: Australia's decision to cap international student enrolments at 270,000 by 2025 may benefit New Zealand as a study destination. With lower visa fees, affordable living costs, and globally recognized qualifications, New Zealand offers an attractive alternative for Indian students seeking higher education abroad.

title: Resident OCI cardholders eligible for loans to study abroad, says RBI
description: The Reserve Bank of India has clarified that Overseas Citizens of India (OCI) cardholders residing in India are eligible for education loans for studies abroad. However, OCIs residing outside India can only get loans from Indian banks for studying within the country. This clarification came after banks sought guidance on the matter.

title: UK universities say visa curbs for international students are hitting them in the pocket
description: Restrictions on visas for international students is causing financial hardship for UK universities, they said on Thursday, calling for a hike in domestic tuition fees to offset yawning deficits. Typically, international students pay more in tuition fees than their domestic counterparts and have become a lucrative source of income for many institutions.

title: Surviving and Thriving: A comprehensive guide for international students
description: Studying abroad is a thrilling yet challenging journey. International students must adapt to new environments, understand local regulations, upskill in AI and Data Analytics, build their personal brand, manage finances wisely, avoid plagiarism, engage in community activities, and utilize university resources effectively for a successful experience.

title: Forbes lists top 10 universities in the US
America's top 10 universities in 2024
description: For the second consecutive year, Princeton University has topped Forbes' list of America's leading colleges and universities, excelling across all 14 metrics used to evaluate educational quality, financial support, and career outcomes. Notably, Princeton boasts a 97% six-year graduation rate for low-income students. The list also saw Rice University make a significant leap, debuting in the top ten at #9, thanks to its low student debt levels.

title: Studying Abroad? Insurers go the extra mile to cover risks
description: Insurance companies are adapting their products to meet the needs of the growing number of Indian students studying abroad. This year, 1.33 million Indians are pursuing higher studies overseas. Increased geopolitical risks and healthcare costs have led insurers like HDFC Ergo, Tata AIG, and ICICI Lombard to offer customized and comprehensive insurance plans. Flexible policies now cover medical expenses, accommodation, and return travel costs, aiming to rival university policies often at a lower cost.

title: US issues new guidelines on OPT eligibility, grace periods, and study abroad for international STEM students
description: The USCIS has issued new guidelines for F and M nonimmigrant students regarding STEM OPT extensions. The revisions cover online study allowances, school transfers, grace periods, and study abroad programs. Effective immediately, these updates apply to all pending and future requests, clarifying several essential rules for international students.

title: International students struggling with poor English still earning master’s degrees in UK: Report
description: A blog by two anonymous professors claims many international students at British universities lack essential English language skills but still obtain degrees. They highlight issues in master's programs, citing poor class engagement and reliance on translation apps. This problem risks UK's higher education standing.

title: How Canadian dream has turned into a gamble for Indian students
description: Canada's pathway to permanent residency for international students and temporary foreign workers, especially from Punjab, is facing disruptions due to unemployment and economic issues. Protests have erupted as the government caps foreign worker numbers, affecting students and workers seeking permanent residency.

title: 7 top-ranked Australian Universities for international students
description: Australia has attracted international students with its top-notch education system, post-study opportunities, and strong faculty support. Notable universities include the University of Melbourne, UNSW, University of Sydney, ANU, Monash University, University of Queensland, and UWA, all part of the prestigious Group of Eight. These universities offer diverse programs, research initiatives, and excellent career prospects.

title: Australia will only accept 270,000 international student enrollments in 2025
description: Australia will cap international student enrollments at 270,000 in 2025 to tackle record migration levels impacting home rental prices. Reforms aim for sustainability in the international student sector, following measures to phase out COVID-era concessions. The country saw a 60% surge in net immigration, fueling housing market pressures.

title: This Canadian province has paused colleges from launching new international programs
description: The Ontario government has imposed a ban on colleges and universities entering new contracts or agreements to offer post-secondary programs abroad. Outgoing Minister of Colleges and Universities, Jill Dunlop, announced the moratorium in a memo, emphasizing the need for institutions to concentrate on their primary mission of serving Ontarians and supporting local communities.

title: Visa figures reveal Indian students being put off applying to UK universities
description: India tops UK's student visa grants tally, despite a 23% decline amid tighter migration curbs. Indian students remain the largest group on the Graduate Route visa, but curbs on bringing dependents affect numbers. UK's education sector faces challenges, while Indian travel and work visa trends also see changes.

title: UK, Canada & Australia losing popularity among international students
description: Studyportals' recent research reveals a growing shift among prospective international students away from Australia, Canada, and the UK, largely due to restrictive immigration policies in these countries. Interest in on-campus programs in Canada and the UK saw an initial rise in January 2024 but then dropped sharply from February to July 2024, particularly for Canada.

title: UK's clampdown on international students has exposed how much universities depend on foreign money
description: Britain's university funding model is in turmoil as many institutions report deficits. The crisis intensified after a drop in international students, prompted by stricter visa rules. Labour suggested addressing the issue but lacked specifics. Proposed solutions include adjusting tuition fees, easing visa restrictions, and seeking alternative income streams to ensure long-term viability.

title: Working in the US as a student: On-campus jobs, OPT, CPT, and visa rules explained
description: Working in the United States as a student offers financial benefits and practical skill development, but requires careful navigation of visa regulations. F1 visa holders can work on-campus without USCIS approval, but must ensure jobs align with their visa status and academic goals. Optional Practical Training (OPT) allows for off-campus work related to a student's major, while Curricular Practical Training (CPT) is for work integral to their academic program.

title: Visa restrictions on international students remain set in stone under UK's new Labour government
description: The UK's ruling Labour Party has confirmed it will not reverse the Conservative government's restrictive student visa policies. Labour's education secretary, Bridget Phillipson, stated that the government does not plan to lift the visa restrictions on international students. She acknowledged the significant contribution of international students but criticized the previous Conservative administration for its approach to higher education.

title: Poland tightens visa rules for international students to prevent abuse
description: Poland has changed its visa rules to require international students to have high school diplomas, aiming to curb the misuse of student visas for illegal work in the EU. This decision follows a scandal involving foreigners obtaining visas without meeting university requirements and using them for work.

title: Heading to Singapore to study? You can bring your mum, dad, or even your grandmother along
description: Singapore's policies let international students to bring along parents or grandparents during studies. According to new rules, male guardians, including fathers and grandfathers, can now apply for long-term visit passes.

title: From Golden Goose to Sitting Ducks: International students are caught in immigration crosshairs
description: The UK, Netherlands, Canada, and Australia have all imposed tougher restrictions on international students to curb immigration, impacting university finances and local economies. These policy shifts occur amid rising domestic opposition to immigration, with the US emerging as a potential beneficiary due to increased international student enrollments.

title: EducationUSA fairs across 8 Indian cities from August 16-25
description: The US higher education sector is hosting a series of EducationUSA Fairs across India from August 16 to August 25. The fairs will visit eight cities—Hyderabad, Chennai, Bangalore, Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Pune, Mumbai, and New Delhi—over 10 days. They offer students an opportunity to connect with representatives from over 80 accredited US universities and colleges for information on admissions, scholarships, and campus life.

title: Decoding Student Housing: Why purpose-built accommodations matter for international students
description: The number of Indian students studying abroad had steadily grown, with a forecast to reach around 1.5 million students by 2025. This rise drove demand for Purpose-Built Student Accommodation (PBSA), which offered tailored living experiences, modern amenities, and high security. Students preferred PBSAs for their convenience and community-focused lifestyle both on-campus and off-campus.

title: New Zealand announces significant visa fee increases from October; student visas to get costlier too
description: New Zealand announced visa fee increases, effective 1 October 2024, to make the immigration system sustainable. The new fees will lessen taxpayer burdens and shift costs to visa applicants. Student visa fees will double but remain lower than Australia's. New Zealand experienced a rise in international student enrolments in 2023, driven mostly by students from China and India.

title: US colleges are cutting majors and slashing programs after years of putting it off
description: During the pandemic, fewer students attended college; nonetheless, officials assumed that attendance would rebound to pre-COVID levels and had used federal relief funds to support their budgets while this was happening, he said.

title: For some, college degree at home is new study abroad
description: International education has become less attractive for Indian students due to tighter visa policies, political unrest, and economic slowdowns in several countries. Indian colleges are emerging as safer and more appealing options. Study abroad platforms are adjusting their business focus to cater to these changing preferences and the growing quality of domestic education.

title: Indians lead in UK university enrollments amid decline in overall migration
description: Indians have maintained the lead as the largest group of foreign students in UK universities, accounting for 26% of non-EU students in the 2022-23 academic year, according to Higher Education Statistics Agency (HESA) data. This surge is attributed to the Graduate Route visa, which allows graduates to stay in the UK for two years to work or seek employment.

title: Vance and Walz Embrace Cheaper Child Care in a Rare Moment of Agreement in the Campaign
description: Both vice-presidential candidates say the government should spend more on child care, a rare point of agreement. But there are still major differences in how they talk about families and gender roles.

description: Hundreds of universities have lent their names to online programs, plugging budgets but alienating students who feel misled.

Their discovery of microRNA and its role in gene regulation has transformed our understanding of how cells control gene activity, providing insights into diseases like cancer and diabetes. Ambros, a professor at the University of Massachusetts Medical School, has pioneered research in gene regulation, making microRNAs a critical focus in modern biology and medicine.

title: What is the Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant (FSEOG)? Check eligibility criteria, application process and other details

Additionally, graduates from key sectors like healthcare, STEM, and agriculture will have a clearer path to securing a PGWP. These changes aim to address Canada’s labour shortages while creating new opportunities for skilled international workers.

This change aims to balance work opportunities with academics, enhancing Canada’s appeal as a top study destination.

description: President Droupadi Murmu on Thursday appointed Mazhar Asif as the vice chancellor of the Jamia Millia Islamia, according to Union Ministry of Education officials

title: Infosys co-founder SD Shibulal: High secondary school dropout rates remains a major challenge in India
description: SD Shibulal, a founding member of Infosys, has dedicated 25 years to philanthropy. His initiative, Shikshagraha, collaborates with local NGOs to improve government schools across India, successfully reversing enrollment declines in regions like Punjab.

title: Union Bank vacancies across 10 states, registration for 1,500 Local Bank Officer posts opens today. Check full details
description: The Union Bank of India opened its online registration window on October 24 for 1,500 vacancies across 10 states. The aspiring candidates must be proficient in the state's regional language.

title: India surpasses China as top source of international students in the US, first time in 15 years
description: India is now the leading source of international students in the United States. Over 330,000 Indian students enrolled in US institutions during the 2023-2024 academic year. This represents a 23% increase from the previous year. The total number of international students in the US reached a new high, exceeding 1.1 million.

title: Australia’s international student caps likely to be blocked
description: Australia's plan to cap international student numbers at 270,000 for 2025 is likely to fail.  The opposition decided to vote against the law, citing concerns about the government's handling of immigration and housing issues. The decision leaves the government without enough votes to pass the legislation.

title: Indian students turn a page amid Canada cold shoulder
description: Canada's decision to halt fast-track visas has left Indian students scrambling for alternative study destinations.  Experts are forecasting a significant drop in Indian students choosing Canada, citing concerns over visa delays, a tight job market, and the rising cost of living.

title: More US states are ditching exams as high school graduation requirements
description: Massachusetts voters decided to eliminate the state's standardized test as a high school graduation requirement, joining a national trend.  Only seven states now mandate such exams amid concerns about excessive testing and equity.  The decision, opposed by business leaders but supported by teachers unions, reflects a broader debate on measuring student readiness beyond standardized tests.

title: Indian students putting off applying to UK universities, report finds
description: Indian student enrollment in UK universities has plummeted by 20.4%, attributed to limited job prospects, safety concerns, and restrictions on dependents.  The decline, coupled with a drop in Nigerian students, poses financial risks to UK universities heavily reliant on international students.

title: Five Indians selected as Rhodes Scholars for studying at Oxford University in 2025
description: Five Indians from diverse academic backgrounds, including law, philosophy, and astrophysics, have been awarded the prestigious Rhodes Scholarship for 2025. They will commence their fully funded postgraduate studies at the University of Oxford in October 2025, joining a global cohort of scholars.

title: How to write a Statement of Purpose for your UK student visa
description: This comprehensive guide equips international students aiming to study in the United Kingdom with effective strategies and practical advice for crafting a compelling Statement of Purpose (SOP). It breaks down essential components to include, from introducing your academic journey to outlining future career goals, emphasizing the document's significance in securing admission.

title: UK universities face funding 'crunch' as foreign students go elsewhere
description: UK universities, renowned globally, are facing financial strain as visa restrictions lead to a decline in international student numbers. Despite being the second most popular destination for foreign students after the US, student visa applications dropped by 5% last year, with a 16% decrease between July and September 2024.

title: Students express concern as Canada ends fast-track SDS visa program
description: Indian students aspiring to study in Canada are expressing anxiety and disappointment over Canada's recent decision to discontinue the Student Direct Stream (SDS) visa program. The program, known for its expedited processing time, was abruptly ended, leaving many students concerned about their academic prospects and questioning the role of political influences in the decision.

title: Canada ends fast-track visa for students from 14 nations
description: Canada discontinued its Student Direct Stream (SDS) visa program for international students to address housing and resource challenges. Implemented in 2018, the program expedited study permit applications for students from 14 countries, including India and China. The Canadian government aims to enhance program integrity and provide equal application opportunities for all students.

title: Canada closes its fast-track Student Direct Stream, effective immediately
description: Canada has closed its Student Direct Stream program. This program helped many Indian students get visas quickly. The program processed applications within 20 days.  Indian students had a higher approval rate through SDS. Now all students will apply through the standard process. This change will affect Indian students who want to study in Canada.

title: India's interest to study agriculture abroad rises
description: Indian students are increasingly pursuing agricultural studies abroad, driven by global demand for sustainable farming practices and immigration opportunities. This trend, fueled by initiatives like the EU's 'Farm to Fork' strategy, has seen a surge in interest from students from both farming and non-farming backgrounds.

title: QS Rankings 2025: List of top 10 universities in Asia
description: In the latest QS Asia University Rankings, Peking University retains its top position.  Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) demonstrate strong performance, with IIT Delhi climbing to 44th, surpassing IIT Bombay which dropped to 48th.  Despite this, other leading Indian institutions experienced slight ranking declines, indicating heightened competition within the Asian academic landscape.

title: Harvard professors cancel classes as students 'feel blue' after Donald Trump's comeback
description: Following Donald Trump’s election victory, several Harvard University professors, including those teaching statistics, ancient Greek history, and modern Chinese culture, either cancelled classes, made attendance optional, or extended deadlines to help students cope, according to The Harvard Crimson.

title: New Trump administration: Students hail green (card) signal
description: The second Trump presidency is unlikely to see a drop in international students in the US, according to Piyush Kumar, regional director, South Asia and Mauritius at IDP Education, a study abroad platform. "This time, he appears more positive towards international students and is going as far as promising green cards for them as he announced in one of his election campaigns," Kumar said, adding that the number of students opting for the US is likely to rise at least 15-20% next year compared to 2024. Most students head to the US for STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) courses.

title: Visa fears for international students as U.S vote nears
description: Nigerian student Ernestino Amaechi fears visa regulations could force him to leave the U.S. and be separated from his children. The presidential election could impact policies on student and work visas, raising concerns among international students about their future prospects in the U.S.

title: Dragon beckons Indian students again amid thaw
description: Indian students may again consider Chinese universities due to easing border tensions and tightening visa policies in destinations like Canada and Australia. Previously, China attracted many Indian students for affordable medical degrees. Experts believe improved diplomatic ties could increase interest in Chinese institutions, despite lingering uncertainties and new competitive destinations.

title: How to not get overwhelmed by your international college applications
description: College admissions have become a massive industry driven by parental and student aspirations. Financial investments alone do not ensure success. A holistic approach involving the right attitude, teamwork, and determination is key. It is important for families to support students strategically, focusing on growth, resilience, and clear communication rather than prestige and monetary commitments.

title: Central Europe to outpace Anglosphere in growth as study destination
description: Italy, Germany, France, Spain, Portugal, Austria and Malta are predicted to outpace the US, UK, Canada and Australia as top study destinations for Indian students by 2030. Increased English-taught courses, affordability and better awareness are factors driving this trend. European countries offer high-quality education and various study options for Indian students.

title: Germany's Dresden University and IIT Chennai sign pact to offer dual degrees
description: Dresden University of Technology and IIT Chennai have signed a dual-degree agreement, aiming to boost academic opportunities for students from both India and Germany. This initiative complements Germany’s increased visa quota for skilled Indian professionals and strengthens bilateral educational ties, enhancing workforce development and global job prospects.

title: 'We have set target of having 30,000 Indian students by 2030,' says French envoy Thierry Mathou
description: France's Ambassador to India, Thierry Mathou, emphasized enhancing Indo-French educational connections at the Choose France Tour 2024. The tour, aimed at attracting 30,000 Indian students to France by 2030, takes place in major Indian cities. Over 11,000 students registered, and 57 universities are participating, focusing on business, engineering, and hospitality programs.

title: 'Serious business': Influencer degree launches in Ireland
description: An Irish university now offers a degree in Content Creation and Social Media. The four-year program at South East Technological University in Carlow aims to teach students how to turn their online presence into revenue. The course covers various topics including video creation, data analytics, and personal branding.

title: How to apply to an international university in the UK?
description: Studying at a UK university offers great academic and personal growth opportunities, but the application process can be complex. Undergraduate students apply through UCAS, submitting personal details, educational qualifications, and a personal statement. Postgraduate applicants can apply directly to universities or via UKPASS. English proficiency proof is essential, and various documents are required. Key deadlines vary, and post-acceptance steps include visa applications and health insurance.

title: French govt launches 'Choose France Tour 2024' to woo Indian students
description: The French government and Campus France launched the "Choose France Tour 2024" on Saturday, aiming to connect with Indian students and showcase diverse academic opportunities in France. The tour features over 50 prestigious French universities and highlights the strong career prospects available, with over 600 French companies operating in India.

title: Trudeau's rant against India could see 20% dip in student interest in Canada, say industry experts
description: Diplomatic strains between India and Canada may cause a 15-20% drop in student interest in Canadian universities, with shifts towards Germany, the Netherlands, Ireland, and the US. Agencies emphasize diplomatic actions to prioritize student welfare as alternative countries gain traction.

title: India-Canada diplomatic fallout: More Indian students may give Canada a miss this fall
description: Interest among Indian students in applying to Canadian universities has dropped significantly due to deteriorating diplomatic relations, rising costs, and employment challenges. Visa and safety concerns contribute to this trend, with educational consultancies noting a reduction of up to 80% in applications for the Fall 2025 session.

title: The Netherlands moves forward with plans to limit English at universities
description: The Dutch government plans to limit English-taught university programs to curb international student numbers. Education Minister Eppo Bruins aims to prioritize the Dutch language, addressing issues like student housing shortages and full lecture halls. The proposal targets reducing English-taught bachelor's programs to one-third. Current statistics show 15% of university students in the country are foreign.

title: MATES program to open doors for Indian students, will help boost industries in Australia: Asst Minister for Immigration
description: Australia's MATES program offers Indian students between 18 to 30 the opportunity for postgraduate study and work in high-demand fields such as AI and renewable energy, addressing Australia's skill shortages while providing valuable experience and skills for participants.

title: Everything you need to know about the Rhodes Scholarship
description: The Rhodes Scholarship offers five opportunities annually for Indian citizens to study at Oxford. Candidates must have studied in India for at least four of the last ten years, meet age requirements, and hold an undergraduate degree by July 2025. The application process involves submitting an online form, academic records, and personal statements. Key documents include proof of citizenship, academic transcripts, and references.

title: All you need to about Chevening Scholarship
description: Chevening Scholarship is the UK Government’s fully funded international scholarship for one-year master's degrees. It provides tuition fees, access to top education, and networking opportunities. Upon completion, scholars join a global alumni community, returning home with valuable knowledge and connections. Applicants must submit education documents, references, and an unconditional UK university offer within the timeline.

title: Canada announces eligible programs for Post-Graduation Work Permits
description: Canada has updated the eligibility criteria for the Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP). Starting November 1, certain international graduates must meet specific field of study requirements aligned with occupation-based Express Entry categories like agriculture, healthcare, STEM, trade, and transport to qualify for a work permit.

title: Indian students walk the course less travelled at foreign campuses
description: Indian students heading abroad for the fall semester of 2024 are diversifying their academic pursuits, ranging from AI and machine learning to fields like kinesiology and gerontology. Countries such as Canada, Ireland, and the UK are emerging as popular destinations for these unconventional courses.

title: 5 red flags that could jeopardize your Ivy League admission
description: Admissions officers look for red flags in applications to identify unqualified candidates. Key pitfalls include not taking rigorous courses, lacking extracurricular activities, having unrelated engagements, maintaining an inappropriate social media presence, and submitting unprofessional essays. High school students should avoid these issues to strengthen their applications and demonstrate readiness for college.

title: A quick guide to UK’s short-term study visa
description: You can apply for a Short-term study visa to take English language courses in the UK lasting from 6 to 11 months. This visa allows you to stay for the course duration plus an additional 30 days, with a fee of £200. A healthcare surcharge of £776 is also required for NHS access. However, you cannot study other courses, work, bring dependants, or extend this visa.

title: All about ​​the UK’s Child Student Visa
description: Children aged between 4 and 17 can apply for a Child Student visa to study at an independent school in the UK. They must have an unconditional offer, sufficient funds, and parental consent. Applications can be made up to 6 months before the course starts, with decisions usually within 3 weeks for overseas applications.

title: World’s top 10 universities 2025
description: Oxford has retained its position as the top university for the ninth consecutive year, attributed to significant enhancements in industry collaboration and teaching quality, according to the latest Times Higher Education report. MIT has moved up to second place, surpassing Stanford, which has dropped to sixth. Meanwhile, Australia’s top universities have declined in rankings due to reduced reputation and international outlook.

title: India's MARG initiative: Connecting students with top US universities
description: The Indian Embassy in Washington, launched a virtual mentoring series, "MARG" (Mentoring for Academic Excellence and Research Guidance), to connect Indian students and researchers with top US universities.
